page.title: 12LIGHTWATER COUNTRY PARK
page.content: Lightwater Country Park is part of Surrey Heath. Up until 1973 it was considered waste land, but it was then changed into 143 acres of park land. Today it is managed by Surrey Heath Borough Council. Lightwater Country Park provides many activities and services including a {nature trail, fitness circuit,a sports {and community centre}consisting of football, cricket, rugby, tennis, badminton and a club room. The{wild life}includes bats,Roe Deer,foxes,snakes, lizards, waterfowl including moorhens, ducks, swans, coots, geese and herons. Grasshoppers, dragonflies and butterflies are some of the insects to be found. There are many plants growing naturally all over the park. Lightwater Country Park is open all year round. It makes a fun day out.
